This weekly bulletin informs students, parents, and staff about internships, academic
programs, jobs, community service options, and leadership initiatives, along with
other student opportunities in a variety of fields. Please carefully note deadlines, age
requirements, and other pre-requisites for participation.
For ease of use, these newsletters are organized by different categories, such as
Academic Programs, Business Internships & Jobs, STEM Opportunities, Community
Service, and so on.
Questions, suggestions, and information about other opportunities are always
welcome and appreciated, and may be sent to Internship/Opportunity Coordinator
Harvey Blumm at: hblumm@stuy.edu - we will share your helpful information with
the Stuy community!
Some new programs to consider are highlighted below:
EVENTS: The APEX Career Connections June 5th virtual event will feature panels
of professionals from TECH, Business, Entertainment & other industries. Planet
Fitness offers free summer passes to its facilities to NYC high school students.
BUSINESS: The CORE Business Student Group at Columbia invites all students to
participate in its September – December hybrid business/finance program. And the
Jane Street finance company welcomes female-identifying students to its free June
programs.
COLLEGE PREP: The free Virtual College Essay Workshop (sponsored by our
ever-supportive Parents & Alumni Associations, along with the Stuy Student Union)
kicks off on June 6th – open to all Stuy students & parents. The free College Passport
Senior Summer Success program for rising seniors welcomes student applications.
And several other excellent free college readiness options are also available – check
them out!
COMMUNITY SERVICE: All female students may volunteer to serve as part or full
time interns at an excellent SHSAT prep program for rising 8th grade female
students from under-represented groups.
Other summer tutoring opportunities are also listed in this section.
GOVERNMENT/LEADERSHIP: The National Security Language Initiative
(NSLI) virtual fall term program welcomes applications for its free instructional
options to learn Chinese, Arabic, Koreans, Russian, and other languages – the
application deadline is June 10th!
MUSEUMS/ART: The Museum of Modern Art’s “In the Making” free summer
program is open to all grades and has a June 6th application deadline. And the Map
Free City multi-arts & writing program includes visits to performances, museums,
and other cultural experiences; it’s based on Governor’s Island is also open to all
students.
STEM: The American College of Cardiology’s Young Scholars Program includes
a full year of mostly virtual presentations & activities on new medical developments.
The University of Pittsburgh Summer Pharmacy virtual program is free and open
to all grades.
THEATER/WRITING/VIDEO: The four-week Broadway for All program offers
theater production, writing & performance options for all grades; the application
deadline is June 3rd.
